title: World Athletics | President
snippet: Upon the death of the fourth IAAF President Primo Nebiolo on November 7, 1999, he immediately took over as acting President and Diack was subsequently re-elected unopposed to the position in 2001, 2003, 2007 and 2011 before standing down in 2015.

title: Lamine Diack becomes first president of the International Association of Athletics Federations | NEWS | World Athletics
snippet: 1 August 2001 – Edmonton, Canada – An overwhelming majority of IAAF Congress delegates has elected Lamine Diack President of the International Association of Athletics Federations. 168 delegates voted for with just 1 delegate against.

title: Lamine Diack - Wikipedia
snippet: Lamine Diack (7 June 1933 – 3 December 2021) was a Senegalese businessman, sports administrator, and athlete. He was president of the International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) from 1999 to 2015. He was the subject of numerous investigations into corruption during his tenure ...

title: World Athletics | IAAF World Championships, Beijing 2015 press conference| News
snippet: IAAF President Lamine Diack took to the stage for the last IAAF World Athletics Series pre-event press conference of his presidency ahead of the IAAF World Championships, Beijing 2015 in the Chinese National Convention Centre on Thursday (20).

title: IAAF limps on as rumours, allegations and innuendo race out of control | World Athletics | The Guardian
